triples.evidence: If you then apply filtered backprojection to reconstruct images from this data, you get motion artifacts

evidence: Iterative Reconstruction with Known Motion Pattern
Motion Artifacts Come from Model Mismatch
An Underlying Structure Keeps Changing While Data Are Collected
The Motion Pattern Can be Taken into Account for Accurate Reconstruction

triples.evidence: Filtered Backprojection creates motion artifacts when applied to data with motion artifacts.

concepts.term: smart computational algorithms that predict motion and correct for it during reconstruction.

evidence: However, if you know the object's motion trajectory, you can incorporate that information into iterative reconstruction algorithms. With this additional information, it is possible to recover accurate images despite motion.
triples.s: Iterative Reconstruction with Known Motion Pattern

triples.evidence: The phantom has a taiji pattern, a yin-yang shape.
